issue.title: move: fixed root source directories getting deleted after move - fixes #1849

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
This fixes the bug where root source directories get deleted after move (caused by ace9a3492438)

In this PR, deletion after a successful move is limited to directories involved in the move. The root directory does get deleted.

body: @ishuah is empty folder removal triggered after everything is finished or does folders get removed immediately. There could be an easy solution without the flag if those folders are removed after everything is moved since in that case we could recreate them at the end of script.

Directory removal is triggered after transfer is finished.
You're proposing to create the deleted directories with your own script after `move`, right?

Is it after all transfers are finished or per transfer 

eg if i do 
rclone move /storage/local remote: 

and its transferring
/storage/local/movies/Title1 
/storage/local/series/TVshow1/Season 01

once ./movie/Title1 is transferred ( but series are still in progress ), will rclone immediately delete /storage/local/movies ... or that happens after all transfers are finished and then cleanup is preformed at the end. 
If thats the case then I could just recreate missing folders after rclone is finished, otherwise I would need to cron or inotify script that will keep recreating folders as soon as they are deleted.

Now I understand your question.
Directory deletion happens after transfers are completed, you can recreate the missing directories after rclone is done.

i agree that it would be nicer if this option was itself a flag on the move command (disabled by default), e.g. ```--delete-empty-dirs``` as alot of people already use their own scripts to remove empty directories.

@l3uddz great idea, I'm all for it.
what do you think, @ncw?
@ishuah a flag on just the move command is a good idea I think and saves the proliferation of global flags.

rename.from: Feature Requests: new flag that will prevent removal of empty folders once rclone move finished
rename.to: Feature Request: add a --delete-empty-dirs flag on the move command

rename.from: Feature Request: add a --delete-empty-dirs flag on the move command
rename.to: Bug: add a --delete-empty-dirs flag on the move command instead of deleting empty dirs automatically

body: Great! I'll put together a PR.

issue.title: source directories are being deleted

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
Source directories are being deleted when empty even if they were not part of the include-from list.  I do not believe this should happen and ESPECIALLY not the base directory itself.  


#1642

HS -> mkdir cams

HS -> mkdir cams/test

HS -> touch cams/test/file

HS -> echo test/file > inc

HS -> mkdir /home/robert/cams2

HS -> rclone  --files-from /home/robert/inc  move /home/robert/cams /home/robert/cams2  -vv
2017/11/21 16:33:32 DEBUG : Using config file from "/home/robert/.rclone.conf"
2017/11/21 16:33:32 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.38-166-gcb6de4a2" starting with parameters ["rclone" "--files-from" "/home/robert/inc" "move" "/home/robert/cams" "/home/robert/cams2" "-vv"]
2017/11/21 16:33:32 INFO  : Local file system at /home/robert/cams2: Modify window is 1ns
2017/11/21 16:33:32 DEBUG : test/file: Sizes differ (src 0 vs dst 2)
2017/11/21 16:33:32 INFO  : test/file: Deleted
2017/11/21 16:33:32 INFO  : Local file system at /home/robert/cams2: Waiting for checks to finish
2017/11/21 16:33:32 INFO  : test/file: Moved (server side)
2017/11/21 16:33:32 INFO  : Local file system at /home/robert/cams2: Waiting for transfers to finish
2017/11/21 16:33:32 DEBUG : test: Removing directory
2017/11/21 16:33:32 DEBUG : Local file system at /home/robert/cams: deleted 1 directories
2017/11/21 16:33:32 DEBUG : Local file system at /home/robert/cams: Removing directory
2017/11/21 16:33:32 INFO  : 
Transferred:      0 Bytes (0 Bytes/s)
Errors:                 0
Checks:                 2
Transferred:            1
Elapsed time:          0s

2017/11/21 16:33:32 DEBUG : Go routines at exit 3
2017/11/21 16:33:32 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.38-166-gcb6de4a2" finishing with parameters ["rclone" "--files-from" "/home/robert/inc" "move" "/home/robert/cams" "/home/robert/cams2" "-vv"]
 robert [~] $
HS -> ls cams
ls: cannot access cams: No such file or directory

issue.title: move: add --delete-empty-src-dirs flag - fixes #1854

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
This PR adds a `--delete-empty-src-dirs` flag to the move command. 
If this flag is set then all empty directories in the source are deleted after move.

fixes #1854
